title: Album Page, "Gable and Tower, Heidelberg", September 16, 1887
medium: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, clockwise from lower left: Heidelberg / Sept 16th 1887; Gable on castle; (inscribed in circle) 46 / 58; tower on Bridge Gate; there were two of these towers on the gate.
description: Vertical sheet illustrating two sketches of architectural details.  At left, a section of a masonry building façade that is heavily decorated with scrolling ornament.  There are two windows with triangular pediments, and the top of the façade projects upward to a pedestal upon which stands the sculpture of a figure.  At right is a very simple tower surmounted by an onion dome with a smooth surface only interrupted by a small chimney stack.  Without interruption, the top of the dome becomes an octagonal steeple with tall finial and decorative banner or weathervane at its top.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Gable and Tower, Heidelberg", September 16, 1887.
September 16, 1887. Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-126.
